KpPlaUce_YmvHPUHvWq7dQ.text: Had a fantastic Sunday brunch at M1LK. As ever it was very busy, so we were sat in the awning outside, but it was still warm enough. I ended up having three flat whites as they were so tasty, just the right balance of milk and coffee. I had the sweet corn fritters with haloumi and avocado, with a side of bacon, and it was just delicious! The fritters were lovely and light, cheese cooked to perfection, and the avocado was ripe and full of flavour. Highly recommended

YdjooQrsbTBxrTdIlzNplw.text: Great coffee 5/5, service pretty good, place is always packed and given the size not much atmosphere to soak up, food is a touch pricey for what you get - great Aussie style brunch options, but £1.80 for a side order of a single small tomato, that's pretty greedy guys...

ZWnta9rk5O_OxwlRfmQTNg.text: best brunch ever! fantastic food and service with a smile. worth the wait!

wA_kZz7H0lxp4-TMCHWNzQ.text: Great service, smoothies, coffees and an amazing eggs benny. Will be recommending this place to everybody for their brunch needs!

vwy5P24kVR-yEsWHBLqbhQ.text: Really cool atmosphere and delicious brunch. My husband and I visited on a Saturday morning and expected big weekend brunch crowds. There was a line out the door - but it moved very quickly, and we were served coffee as we waited in line which definitely helped! Honestly it was worth waiting for. The food was fantastic, and we loved the vibe of the restaurant. Highly recommend!

VInJWeDlV66ZxgizrXCp8w.text: The breakfast here is really good and creative. For that, it gets 5 star.The one star deduction comes from the fact that this place is way too small. They've essentially used a triangle shaped leftover corner space, which makes dining here an incredibly cramped experience. Except in the summer, when you can sit outdoors.If going on a Saturday or Sunday, be prepared for queues and a long wait.

SqwrgVdz5kogqhYfXdgWgw.text: Who knew that there was such a delightfully hipster cafe in SW12?!Not me.Unexpected awesomeness. Bloody fantastic coffee. Delicious brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Milk - London, United Kingdom

0AWnMKjEhIYmsMAucC-n5A.text: I had such an enjoyable lunch at m1lk.  I wasn't sure what my taste buds were in the mood for so I asked for suggestions. The young bloak at the counter (yurp...totally immersed myself in the culture) suggested that I try the sweet corn fritters which turned out to be a great selection.  Fritters with avacado, haloumi cheese, salsa, and bacon made for a really nice combo of flavors.A small quaint environment with a nice soundtrack in the background made for a nice nibbling spot.

OVJZpKhfh9Kj85eE7FGGEw.text: Great brunch spot! Delicious coffee! Everything i have tried on the menu was good.The only downside is the queue on weekends but it does go pretty quickly! And this place is worth the wait!

iYv31fiIJM1YPwa96S7TXQ.text: If you're feeling indecisive like I sometimes do, just order two mains. We came here for brunch after a night out and the convict (everything you could want for breakfast in a roll) and the corn fritters were both calling to me.... I did manage to kill them both with a little help from my friends. Lovely staff, good food, a queue that looks worse than it actually is, it's a weekend winner. The apple meets mint tea was recommended... just let it brew for a long while... it's delightful.

UxLz5cSKTN_mumPxg04SJw.text: The food was great (had the Convict) but the customer service left a little to be desired. It's definitely worth it for the food items but hopefully they'll get nicer, more accommodating staff. My friend specified that she would like scrambled egg whites which they confirmed they could do but ended up not doing it and saying they couldn't actually do it (egg whites are fairly easy to make, don't know what the issue was)

uE2drn34CAed3rKZmaGbpw.text: M1lk was the first restaurant I ate in after moving to London. I was feeling homesick and stumbled in to the Balham location. I tried the homemade cornbread with honey and an iced coffee. I'm from the South -- pretty sure this is the best cornbread I've ever had. The iced coffee was absolutely delicious. I've also tried the baked eggs with butternut squash and feta cheese, and I've tried the sweet corn fritters. Everything I've had has been tasty and fresh. Very friendly and unpretentious staff. My only complaint...and it's not with them, is the long lines that form on the weekend. It's best to get there at 8am when they open or be ready to sit outside and eat. I'm already getting bummed about leaving this Summer -- am going to miss Milk! Wish they'd open one in Tampa, Florida. :)

GFzNKFrdVf3maDCa0DrYCQ.text: I just love M1lk. A wave of disappointment came over me when I saw the line this morning, but it moved quickly and it was a nice day to stand in the sunshine. I wanted to be adventurous but couldn't go past the käsekrainer baked eggs I had on my first visit - so, so good. The coffee is glorious and the fruit smoothies delicious. Definitely one of my favourite brunch spots.

photos.caption: Photo of Milk - London, United Kingdom. Kasekrainer baked eggs with crispy spinach balls and labneh
Photo of Milk - London, United Kingdom. Flat white

tre_GTB0oJa5BTRmrlL2mQ.text: This place has outstanding coffee and food. You can tell a lot of love has gone into every ingredient. The staff is also very polite. Can't wait to come back.

gMyM_NRvZ6flVQBVe2rN3A.text: Good brunch but be aware it's cash only. Went here on a Thursday early afternoon and the place was still hopping. Can't even imagine how crowded it gets on weekends. Definitely a must go if you can get a place to sit! Decent size portions and good iced coffee.

fSJvK1OD4CvJOuLJdd8uNA.text: Really lovely for weekend brunch. Not exactly cheap so it's a treat but well worth it. Very trendy but relaxed and fun. Go early to beat the queues and take cash.

0CpSjBk17zkbeOJIPV7eVA.text: Awesome breakfast, probably one of the top places in Balham, we had the  avocado sweet corn fritters and poached eggs, with a chai latte and flat white.. All Super! Only downside is its currently cash only, and no table service... On the plus side it means as youve paid and ordered beforehand at the bar, you can leave as soon as youre finished..great!

photos.caption: Photo of Milk - London, United Kingdom. Flat White
Photo of Milk - London, United Kingdom. Poached eggs
Photo of Milk - London, United Kingdom. Sweetcorn Fritters

A2jZvh6XG5pMJlg3Ov05eA.text: I absolutely loved this place. It had a really hipster, bohemian feel without trying too hard which is the only way bohemian ever works in my opinion! The menu is very small but perfectly executed and my dish,  was delicious (I can't even remember what I was but it had halloumi cheese in it) I also had a lois smoothie which was great!

gKp-6nZ903hsle-81ut-0A.text: Cool little coffee shop in Balham (they have been growing in number as of late) that offers a tasty food and REAL coffee to its patrons. Mixed and matched wooden tables and chairs share this light and pleasant space. The staff are young, hip and nice. I had the scrambled eggs on toast - really, really good. The free wifi entices you to stay and surf and/or work.

photos.caption: Photo of Milk - London, United Kingdom. Take a seat at the big table and make new friends!

kJw0bmsCICm7Z_yX0aVJKw.text: Lovely place for some aussie long black coffee and greasy, but very good brekkie or brunch.

PqBp9JRx1mW6LqBxrmZ44w.text: lovely place for breakfast in balham. it's small, so expect a wait. on sunny days there is outside seating, which must be a great for m1lk as it increases their covers by over 50% for sure!my fiance and i both got the lauren smoothie, which was a milk pint glass of strawberries, mangos and bananas. they write on the menu that they get their fruit from hildred st market (part of the street they are on), however, we watched the dude make a mad run to sainsburys to pick up mango juice, so that is not strictly true...(sneaky!!!). still delicious though, and i thought fairly priced for the size of smoothie.i had the sweetcorn fritters with halloumi, smashed avocado and some sort of red salsa-y type sauce. it was delicious, and a good size when paired with the filling smoothie, but maybe slightly overpriced if you ate that on its own. my fiance had the thing that everyone was having - 'the convict' which was basically an extremely fancy mcdonald's sausage mcmuffin! it was presented beautifully and he said it was delicious so two thumbs up to that.the menu is small, but i like that as it's easier to do it well, and i personally don't like having all the choice in the world when everything looks amazing!you should expect a wait - i have never been past here and not seen a queue, but it moves quickly (maybe 20-30 minutes, which trust me, is quick when you see the length of the queue and the amount of people eating!). service is hit or miss but i think that's because everyone has their specific duties, and they are super busy trying to get everyone seated and enjoying the food/drinks. the guy who was doing the table seating was really competent, and friendly, so it's all good. i'll definitely be back on a sunny day (when i can bring my dog along - only dog friendly outside!)

gXZItLYSGL9obIcVn4LSTg.text: The food here is SO GOOD! Really lovely antipodean brunch style menu and the coffees are great. I love eating on the benches on the pavement when the sun is out - it's far enough away from the main road to not be surrounded by traffic noises. There's usually a bit of a line on weekends but that's because it's so good!

iM5UGwxsqXxnqX2q2x1ebQ.text: I would give this place 5 stars but I am a grinch and I despise queuing. Especially in the nicer months you will have to queue for around 20mins at least for a table. That being said once inside/outside the food is excellent and the staff are always very helpful and friendly.

1AsOZ3lDF6IxQg8tXHuMnA.text: My very favourite place in London to have brunch! The food is amazing and really different, and the vintage decor is right up my street. The staff are excellent too, and remembered me even when I was new to the area. The only downside is the queues - but it's well worth the wait!

HlC6iQH6TkMkA6ev5va1qQ.text: Incredible brunch. Apparently weekday mornings (11am) are the time to come--I easily found a table for 2. Other reviews on here make it sound like a madhouse, and I've heard it's near impossible to find a table on weekends.I got the "young betty" with bacon -- poached eggs on sourdough with hollandaise. The sourdough was a little more toasted than I'd usually like, but not burnt. The eggs and hollandaise though...UNBELIEVABLE. Still dreaming of how good that was. My sister got the crumpets with goats curd and honey. I had a bite and it was also incredible--I regret not coming back again to try more. Free wifi, which is always a plus!

bOSIJfJ37epmgjAo_Fgz0Q.text: Loved this place! I wish it wasn't that far from central London so we could visit more than once. Food was great and service was good for UK standards (which I learned it isn't as good as the US). Had the convict sandwich and it was outstanding!My only complaint was that their coffee mugs and particularly their water carafes are in really poor condition. All 3 of the water carafes that we received were chipped by the mouth area- and it had what appeared to be mold due to the chipping. This is a potential health hazard so we just didn't drink any water there. Overall it's a great place for breakfast but watch out for the chipped drink ware!

ovZvvfkZ7mAqFIqhzXJ3Tg.text: I adore milk. I used to live in the area and hadn't been back in a few years but I'm happy to say the food is still great and the service matches. I ordered the sourdough with scrambled eggs/sausage and randomly ordered the halloumi as well. Everything was super good - I wish I still lived in the area so I could come back more often!

ydij7Oor2yESBf8f02qejA.text: A nice, gourmet brunch place in upscale Balham. It's busy for weekend brunches for good reason: excellent takes on breakfast food that you can't create easily at home - this is what makes Milk better than your average greasy spoon-made hipstery brunch joint. They make excellent coffees and smoothies as well. Worth a try. The brunch dishes are creative and tasty, not overfilling and the atmosphere is easy going. The staff are super nice and eager to explain dishes and help.

photos.caption: Photo of Milk - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Milk - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Milk - London, United Kingdom

NEWfOteWGT89AK_5IZfH1g.text: If you are hungry you have to try "the convict"The ice coffe is awesomeAnd the smoothie is super

photos.caption: Photo of Milk - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Milk - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Milk - London, United Kingdom

BT_eASYG_Tdo9hiWPSyYhA.text: Perfect little Melbourne style cafe to help ease the homesickness. Comforting to see Anzac biscuits and lamingtons on display. Went for brunch with an Aussie friend to recover from big Halloween night. I had the convict with yummy hangover sauce with a Lois Smoothie: blackberry, pear and lavender. My friend had a Lauren Smoothie: Mango, banana and strawberry with sour dough toast with plum and lavender jam. This was a very cozy cafe with a fantastic menu. Only felt it was missing a sweet option like pancakes. Defiantly will go again if in the Balham area. TIP: Expect a wait time for your table as there is usually a queue. We waited 10-15 minutes.

photos.caption: Photo of Milk - London, United Kingdom. The Convict with hangover sauce and a Blackberry, pear and lavender smoothie.

e9KXg8nN_qxb3yG-3b2g8w.text: Visited Milk second time for brunch and they did not disappoint! Must try items: baked eggs, the convict, cornbread (a bit steep in price as they only give 1 slice of bread), horchata and table beer. There will be a bit of a wait so come prepared.

photos.caption: Photo of Milk - London, United Kingdom. Black lime horchata (divine) ans green tea
Photo of Milk - London, United Kingdom. Baked eggs - butternut squash

Msh7JtFr947r3UXi5hxZ4w.text: Yaaaaaassss. This was the first brunch place I visited when I was fresh from Aus, cold, damp and ready to give up on ever finding a good coffee in London. It's kind of pricey, but serves up excellent food and coffee. Passes my Aussie snob test with flying colours. Portion sizes are slightly on the small side for the price, but perfect for me as I tend to have the appetite of a flea. If you're a very hungry human you may be slightly disappointed...or have to order two breakfasts....there are worse things.

photos.caption: Photo of Milk - London, United Kingdom. COFFEE
Photo of Milk - London, United Kingdom. Corn fritters with bacon (duh), halloumi & avo.

T8tQ1s8IaqgtoRubzzJ73w.text: There's a reason why there's a queue out the door every.single.weekend. The servers are awesome, the cooks, awesome. The outdoor seating - you guessed it - awesome. I give it 5 stars because I like to spend my money on quality and if any place that repeated lures me back for more simply by being true to itself (& innovating...love the Mexican twist on a few menu items, btw) then it deserves my money and my stars! Thanks again for the good food and the good service. *thumbs up*

photos.caption: Photo of Milk - London, United Kingdom. Rhubarb on rhubarb on rhubarb, with a cheeky wink of rosemary syrup because they know how to flirt...

ftPD8LWtnm4pnLnLB3-ouw.text: Breakfast wasn't too bad. Sweet Maria: Alright. Corn fritters aren't really a staple anywhere so the trend of it is more of the oomph rather than the taste of it. Baked Eggs/Butternut Squash: Alright for the balance, but didn't take the flavor anywhere unexpected. Just well cooked eggs, and well cooked squash. The options that aren't on the menu (soft scramble with cheese and toast) honestly look and probably taste a lot better. Doing the classics and pushing them should also be the standard over the adventurous but that's why I went for a three. Visually not a bad meal to look at.

QkZ2_efhjltQN9a_18U6Pg.text: Usually very sceptical of places with long queues not living up to the hype! I was put in my place by milk cafe though. We got there just before the line at about 11am, but when we were leaving it was really long. We had amazing sweetcorn fritters with haloumi, smoothies in milk bottles, and great coffee. Definitely can't complain with this brunch spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Milk - London, United Kingdom

Q7eT0asLDsmZkclm7A2YzA.text: Loud music and awkward design are the perfect accompaniment to the oily slurp. I had heard so many great things about this place, and was excited to come and try the baked eggs, corn fritters and horchata. The horchata and green tea were good, but super small! Our waitress was lovely, quick, polite and attentive, but that doesn't make for a return visit.I think the main problem is, they're trying to get so many people through the door that you lose a lot of the details as you're rushed through. It was easy to see evidence of rapid cooking: burnt toast and eggs, tons of butter, and lots of oil remaining in the salsa and fritters. They have a tiny kitchen, and are super popular, so I guess it figures that quality will slip. But the uncomfy seats, and gimmicky branding just scream 'try hard hipster' a little too loudly. Great place to go and pose. Bad place to expect good food.

7yL5dHD0cY6pZtrxWKBZrQ.text: I've lots of friends that live south and they've raved about M1lk for a while.This weekend I finally made it! Despite the long (but expected) queue it was fine as we stood in the sun and chatted until we were seated. I must say the staff were a bit rubbish at minimising the queue... We saw empty tables the entire time we were there and no rush to fill them. Not a fan of that! I am however a fan of the delicious food. We all had variations of the sweet Maria... Sweetcorn fritters with avocado and halloumi, topped with salsa, mine with added bacon and a poached egg.It was amazing! I couldn't stop talking about how tasty it was.I washed it down with the Lauren (it had to be done!)... Mango, banana and strawberry juice in a very fitting milk bottle. All in all it was a great brunch experience. Good food, lovely interior, nice setting. It was a little pricey, but I'm okay with that for a fab brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Milk - London, United Kingdom. Sweetcorn fritters, bacon, halloumi, and avocado topped with salsa, with the cutest little poached egg on the side!
Photo of Milk - London, United Kingdom. Lauren slurping the Lauren

E1g0750CndNnXV0Wh9gDMw.text: I couldn't help but be swayed by the glowing reviews, so persuaded my pal to meet here for brunch. The weather was unusually glorious, so we sat outside, mainly as I didn't want to wait ages for a table inside. Be mindful, though, that you end up sitting v close to your fellow brunchers, so if you want a particularly private conversation, maybe best for another time. The service was slow, I think we waited at least 20mins. However it was rammed, so understandable. Still, the food was top notch. Like many before me, I went for the sweetcorn fritters, which were light and delicious. My mate had a huge silky portion of scrambled eggs on sourdough.A guy to my left had ordered The Convict - eggs, muffin and crispy bacon which looked excellent also. Price point is average for London, quality definitely above average. Bonus points for outdoor seating in the sun. No crying over Milk here.

Zz-ulM2se5NbMC6-p0XBjA.text: Milk is a great brunch spot. From their breakfasts to their specialised drinks, everything was delicious. The place has a cozy atmosphere and friendly servers as well. Highly recommend; however you might have to wait to be served.

photos.caption: Photo of Milk - London, United Kingdom. The convict

IZwukOkYeYeqVsrNVmwAwQ.text: This is one of the best brunch places in London, luckily for me it is just around the corner from where I live. Good food, coffee and vibe. Plus I like the water jugs with lemon and herbs!It gets busy so get there early if you plan on visiting on the weekends, otherwise you will need to queue.

1xmtFLjtkeRKGa7M35wfrg.text: I finally went for brunch at M1LK - it had some big shoes to fill (plates to fill?)...we had built up expectations since planning for it back in February.   No, literally.  A plate of brunch 6 weeks in the making:Sorted out the crew that would accompany me (serious brunchers only!).  Sorted out the time (right when it opens, please!).  Even sorted out my meal choice (fritters or breakfast sammich, yes!).We got there and were seated quickly: hurrahs! (Tip: opens at 9, so be there at 9)Though teeny, the space is super-cute and creatively arranged to maximize the small space (one high communal table, little clusters of inside seating, outside picnic table-style seating).  The menu is perfect in length; diverse, but without overwhelming choice (I say this as a definite pro, being an indecisive bruncher).  Various combos of breakfast meats and eggs and riffs on the benny.  The coffee is Workshop, and the flat white they made was deliciously on-point and in a beautiful robin's egg blue cup.  I ultimately opted for a breakfast "sandwich" (note: too large to eat as such) with buttered buns, scrambled eggs, bacon, a triangle of hash brown, a sausage patty and "hangover sauce".  Hangover sauce!  What attracted me in the description was what killed the execution.  The sauce was...not well-received at our table (2/3 of us made the same order).  My pal described it as "barbecued salsa"...in a bad way.  And it was room temperature and just totally killed the flavour and temperature and crispness of the other (delicious components).  There were attempts made to scrape away, to work around and yet...that sauce.  Dealbreaker.Prices fair, good vibe, nice bustle.  Want to give it another try with some different choices.Yelp note: one loo, so...do as I say not as I did: don't wait until the very last minute to rush down to the basement.  Also: CASH ONLY!

5m3MZFBE_mWj313_1tQixA.text: 5stars from me for this fabulous brunch spot! After a very tiring week, I was v.annoyed to find myself wide awake at 6.30am on a Saturday and I couldn't get back to sleep. Argh! I decided to make the best of it, and a flash of inspiration reminded me that I had bookmarked this place to visit for brunch sometime but I had pretty much decided I would never get there because it is very popular and they don't take bookings, and I'm not (usually) an early riser at the weekend and I do not like to queue for a table! It turns out that being wide awake at stupid o'clock can be the best thing to happen to you! I was about the 3rd person to arrived at m1lk shortly after it opened at 8am so I had my pick if the tables. I chose the best seat in the house, the table right in the tip of this flat-iron shaped building so I had views all around me of the street outside waking up, and the market setting up. It's a slightly self-consciously hipstery dude place - all beards and mismatched furniture and achingly artisanal produce like Brixton sourdough and hay smoked goats curds - but it kinda works and it has a relaxed, buzzy feel about it; and the food - oh my, the food is incredibly good. I ordered what seemed to be a favourite among the yelp reviewers - the sweet Maria sweetcorn pancakes (fritters?) with halloumi and salsa and dry cure bacon and avocado and it was divine. The pancakes were fluffy and sweet, the halloumi and the bacon were salty and savoury with just the right amount of charring to balance the fritters. The salsa was deliciously tangy and sweet and tomatoey - it tasted somehow like summer / and this too was the perfect balance to the creamy mashed avocado on the side. My accompanying flat white was gloriously malty. It's not a cheap brunch option but I don't mind paying a premium for such great quality food that sets you up for the day like this. I'd like to say i will definitely be back, but by the time j left at around 9.30am, the place was mobbed so the chances of me being awake early enough to get a table again are slim. In fact, no, scrub that - I will be back, even if I have to set my alarm clock. A brunch so good, I'd set my alarm at the weekend? There genuinely is no higher praise!

photos.caption: Photo of Milk - London, United Kingdom. The sweet Marie sweetcorn fritters with halloumi, bacon and avocado. Words cannot express how delicious this is.
Photo of Milk - London, United Kingdom. Menu

zswZm3gYL9iRzPYQab_nkg.text: I really enjoyed this place! it has a funky hipster alt vibe in Balham... I mean their name is spray painted over the last business that used to be there so I almost walked past it as I couldn't read the sign from the street clearly. It was super busy when we arrived so we had to fight for a seat so come with some patience.I had the Kurdish Baked eggs with Chorizo, Spinach, Labneh, & Kirmizi Biber. Labneh is a beautiful touch it is a strained yogurt like cheese. Truly enjoyed my dish and will be sure to make another brunch date here soon!I would give it 5 starts if it had more variety on the menu and more seats!

photos.caption: Photo of Milk - London, United Kingdom. Food
Photo of Milk - London, United Kingdom. Cake stand
Photo of Milk - London, United Kingdom. Smoothie

8nOAswjfhb14yT6LbP32Ow.text: Best breakfast spot in London. Particularly when the weathers nice it is lovely to sit outside on the benches. Delicious smoothies arrive in milk bottles and their sausage bacon egg sandwich is so delicious. Cannot recommend more than enough. !!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Milk - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Milk - London, United Kingdom
